_comment: PSA event calendar. Dates use MM-DD format for recurring annual events. When an event falls within the lookahead window (default 7 days) and matches an org on today's roster, that org gets featured with the event-specific PSA angle. Update approximate dates annually for floating events (e.g. Mental Health Week).

events.name: Skates for All season
events.psa_angle: The Conservation Society's Skates for All program is collecting donated skates — kids' sizes 7 to 10 are always in demand. Drop them off at Total Ice or the Cariboo Memorial Recreation Complex.

events.name: Heritage Day
events.psa_angle: Heritage Day is a chance to celebrate the diverse cultural heritage of our region. The Cariboo Friendship Society has been part of that story since 1969.

events.name: World Water Day
events.psa_angle: It's World Water Day. The Conservation Society's Water Wise program teaches Cariboo communities about protecting our watersheds — programs available for schools and community groups.

events.name: National Poetry Month
events.psa_angle: April is National Poetry Month. CCACS supports local writers and artists year-round through grants and programming at the Arts Centre.

events.name: Earth Day
events.psa_angle: Happy Earth Day. Scout Island Nature Centre runs volunteer stewardship programs all spring and summer — check scoutisland.ca for upcoming birding walks and nature programs.

events.name: National Volunteer Week
events.psa_angle: It's National Volunteer Week. {org_name} is always looking for volunteers — visit {org_website} to find out how you can help.

events.name: Red Dress Day (MMIWG)
events.psa_angle: Today is Red Dress Day, honouring missing and murdered Indigenous women and girls. The Cariboo Friendship Society's PEACE program provides prevention, education, advocacy, counselling, and empowerment services.

events.name: Mental Health Week
events.psa_angle: It's Mental Health Week. CMHA Cariboo Chilcotin offers free counselling and support right here in Williams Lake. Reach them at 250-398-8220, or in crisis, call 310-6789 any time.

events.name: Aboriginal Awareness Week
events.psa_angle: It's Aboriginal Awareness Week. CCATEC provides workforce development and employment training across Carrier, Chilcotin, and Secwépemc nations — supporting people in building careers close to home.

events.name: Trail season opens
events.psa_angle: Trail season is here. First Journey Trails and the Indigenous Youth Mountain Bike Program are gearing up — a great time to get involved or register youth for summer rides.

events.name: Scout Island Nature House opens
events.psa_angle: Scout Island's Nature House opens for the season this month. Nature Kids Club memberships are just $35 per family per year. Visit scoutisland.ca to register.

events.name: National Indigenous History Month
events.psa_angle: June is National Indigenous History Month. {org_name} continues to serve our region's Indigenous communities — learn more at {org_website}.

events.name: National Indigenous Peoples Day
events.psa_angle: Happy National Indigenous Peoples Day. Denisiqi Services Society has been providing culturally grounded support for Tŝilhqot'in and Ulkatcho families for over 20 years.

events.name: Performances in the Park
events.psa_angle: CCACS Performances in the Park brings free live music to Boitano Park every Thursday evening this summer. Check centralcaribooarts.com for this week's lineup.

events.name: Williams Lake Stampede
events.psa_angle: The Williams Lake Stampede is coming up on Canada Day weekend. The Stampede Association is a nonprofit that brings the whole community together — volunteer spots and event info at williamslakestampede.com.

events.name: BC Cowboy Hall of Fame induction
events.psa_angle: The Museum of the Cariboo Chilcotin welcomes new inductees into the BC Cowboy Hall of Fame this Canada Day weekend. Stop by and celebrate our ranching heritage.

events.name: Scout Island summer programs
events.psa_angle: Scout Island Nature Centre is running kids' summer programs all season — each week has a different theme like Water, Bugs, or Birds. Sign up at scoutisland.ca.

events.name: Back to school — literacy programs
events.psa_angle: Back to school season is a great reminder that Partners for Literacy offers free adult education and digital skills programs. It's never too late to learn something new.

events.name: Scout Island Salmon Trip
events.psa_angle: Scout Island's Salmon Trip takes students on a three-day adventure at Gavin Lake — brood stock collection, stream surveys, and hands-on salmon habitat research. Apply at scoutisland.ca.

events.name: Culture Days
events.psa_angle: It's Culture Days. CCACS and local arts organizations are hosting open studios, workshops, and free events across the Central Cariboo.

events.name: National Day for Truth and Reconciliation
events.psa_angle: Today is the National Day for Truth and Reconciliation. The Cariboo Friendship Society has served our community since 1969, providing culturally grounded support, housing, and youth programming.

events.name: Mental Illness Awareness Week
events.psa_angle: It's Mental Illness Awareness Week. CMHA Cariboo Chilcotin is here for you — free counselling, housing support, and crisis services. Call 250-398-8220 or visit cariboo.cmha.bc.ca.

events.name: Waste Reduction Week
events.psa_angle: It's Waste Reduction Week. The Conservation Society's Waste Wise program works with schools and businesses across School District 27 to reduce waste in the Cariboo.

events.name: Thanksgiving food drive
events.psa_angle: This Thanksgiving, consider donating to the Salvation Army Williams Lake food bank. They provide free meals and hampers to families across the community.

events.name: National Addictions Awareness Week
events.psa_angle: It's National Addictions Awareness Week. CMHA Cariboo Chilcotin provides local addiction support and operates Jubilee House, helping residents connect with housing, benefits, and treatment.

events.name: Remembrance Day
events.psa_angle: On Remembrance Day, we honour those who served. Central Cariboo Search and Rescue carries on that spirit of service — their volunteers are always ready to respond when our community needs them.

events.name: Giving Tuesday
events.psa_angle: It's Giving Tuesday. {org_name} does vital work right here in the Cariboo — consider a donation at {org_website}.

events.name: International Volunteer Day
events.psa_angle: It's International Volunteer Day. {org_name} relies on volunteers to serve our community. Visit {org_website} to find out how you can help.

events.name: Holiday hamper season
events.psa_angle: The Salvation Army is running their Christmas hamper program. Families can sign up to receive a holiday food hamper, and donations of food and toys are welcome.

events.name: Holiday hospice support
events.psa_angle: The holidays can be a difficult time for those who've lost someone. Williams Lake Hospice Society offers grief support and companionship — all volunteer, all local. Visit williamslakehospice.com.

events.name: Holiday pet adoption
events.psa_angle: Looking for a new family member this holiday season? BC SPCA Williams Lake has animals waiting for forever homes. Visit spca.bc.ca to see who's available.

events.name: Year-end giving — hospital
events.psa_angle: The Cariboo Memorial Hospital Foundation has raised nearly four million dollars for equipment at our local hospital — all through community donations. Consider a year-end gift at cmhospitalfoundation.ca.
